<metadata>
<idinfo>
<citation>
<citeinfo>
<origin>U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) <http://www.usgs.gov/>, Coastal and Marine Geology Program (CMGP) <http://marine.usgs.gov/></origin>
<pubdate>20131029</pubdate>
<title>
Geophysical data of field activity O-1-02-GM in Northwest
Gulf of Mexico from 06/08/2002 to 06/28/2002
</title>
<pubinfo>
<pubplace>Menlo Park, CA</pubplace>
<publish>U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) <http://www.usgs.gov>, Coastal and Marine Geology (CMG) <http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov></publish>
</pubinfo>
<onlink>http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/gos/o-1-02-gm.fmeta.xml</onlink>
<onlink>http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/o/o102gm/html/o-1-02-gm.meta.html</onlink>
</citeinfo>
</citation>
<descript>
<abstract>
University of New Brunswick,United States Geological Survey,
Menlo Park, California,C&C Technologies, Inc.. Chief
Scientist: Jim Gardner. Geophysical data (multibeam, GPS,
motionsensor, CTDmeter, acousticbackscatter) of field
activity O-1-02-GM in Northwest Gulf of Mexico from
06/08/2002 to 06/28/2002,
http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/o/o102gm/html/o-1-02-gm.meta.html.
</abstract>
<purpose>
These data and information are intended for science
researchers, students from elementary through
college, policy makers, and general public.
</purpose>
<supplinf>

Equipment Used -

multibeam                     Kongsberg Simrad EM1000 bathymetry and acoustic backscatter

GPS                           Trimble 4000DGPS

motionsensor                  inertial motion sensor INS

CTDmeter                      SeaBird 1902 water column sound velocity

acousticbackscatter

Notes -

For raw and intermediate data sets, contact

<a href="http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/programs/html/staff2html/staff/Rani_Nandiwada.html">Rani Nandiwada</a>

Publications -

Beaudoin, J.D., Gardner, J.V., and Hughes Clarke, J.E., 2002, RV Ocean

Surveyor Cruise O1-02-GM Bathymetry and Acoustic Backscatter of Seleceted

areas of the Outer Continental Shelf, Northwestern Gulf of Mexico,

available on-line at:

<A HREF="http://geopubs.wr.usgs.gov/open-file/of02-410/"target="of">

http://geopubs.wr.usgs.gov/open-file/of02-410</A>

<br>

<HR>

<i>National Seafloor Mapping and Benthic Habitat Studies, NW Gulf of Mexico</i>, 2006,

U.S. Geological Survey, Western Coastal and Marine Geology&nbsp;&nbsp;

<a class="locationLink" href="http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/pacmaps/wg-index.html" target="wg">

&lt;http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/pacmaps/wg-index.html&gt;</a>

Similar information is available for thousands
of other USGS/CMG-related Activities.

If known, available are Activity-specific
navigation, gravity, magnetics, bathymetry,
seismic, and sampling data; track maps; and
equipment information; as well as summary
overviews, crew lists, and information
about analog materials.

If available, access to physical samples is
described in the "WR CMG Sample Distribution
Policy" at:
http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/programs/html/main/sample-dist-policy.html

Primary access to the USGS/CMG Information
Bank's digital data, analog data, and
metadata is provided through...
http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/

This page accomodates a variety of search
approaches (e.g., by platform, by region,
by scientist, by equipment type, etc.).
</supplinf>
</descript>
